item.title: Jessica add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as I’ve said before, bugs in amber." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Many people need desperately to receive this message: 'I feel and think much as you do, care about many of the things you care about, although most people do not care about them. You are not alone." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Who is more to be pitied, a writer bound and gagged by policemen or one living in perfect freedom who has nothing more to say?" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "There is no WHY, since the moment simply is, and since all of us are simply trapped in the moment, like bugs in Amber." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "And in that moment, I swear we were infinite." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We need not to be let alone. We need to be really bothered once in a while. How long is it since you were really bothered? About something important, about something real?" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I'm seventeen and I'm crazy. My uncle says the two always go together. When people ask your age, he said, always say seventeen and insane." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "There are too many of us, he thought. There are billions of us and that's too many. Nobody knows anyone. Strangers come and violate you. Strangers come and cut your heart out. Strangers come and take your blood. Good God, who were those men? I never saw them before in my life!" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "No long-term marriage is made easily, and there have been times when I've been so angry or so hurt that I thought my love would never recover. And then, in the midst of near despair, something has happened beneath the surface. A bright little flashing fish of hope has flicked silver fins and the water is bright and suddenly I am returned to a state of love again — till next time. I've learned that there will always be a next time, and that I will submerge in darkness and misery, but that I won't stay submerged. And each time something has been learned under the waters; something has been gained; and a new kind of love has grown. The best I can ask for is that this love, which has been built on countless failures, will continue to grow. I can say no more than that this is mystery, and gift, and that somehow or other, through grace, our failures can be redeemed and blessed." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jessica add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "We shall meet in the place where there is no darkness." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jessica add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jessica add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "He was conscious of nothing except the blankness of the page in front of him, the itching of the skin above his ankle, the blaring of the music, and a slight booziness caused by the gin." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jessica add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Perhaps one did not want to be loved so much as to be understood." -- George Orwell

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "They're in love. Fuck the war." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What are men to rocks and mountains?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Every man with a little leisure and enough money for railway tickets, every man, indeed, who knows how to read, has it in his power to magnify himself, to multiply the ways in which he exists, to make his life full, significant and interesting." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "I like being myself. Myself and nasty." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description: "We are focusing on the small details and hiding the misery in the world. Look at the smoker and we miss global warming, war, and the crap we eat--not the bad guys but smoking. I smoke and they talk about cancer, I eat and they talk about cholesterol, I make love, it's AIDS. Before AIDS and cholesterol and cancer there's the pleasure of making love and eating and smoking. I have to die someday, so if the thing that gave me pleasure all of my life kills me instead of me going under a truck, that's fine. Besides, why should I live so that when I die I give fresh meat to the worms? I hope that I am rotted and they don't want to eat me. F@#$ck the worms." -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "We used to build civilizations. Now we build shopping malls." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "In France, a chemist named Pilatre de Rozier tested the flammability of hydrogen by gulping a mouthful and blowing across an open flame, proving at a stroke that hydrogen is indeed explosively combustible and that eyebrows are not necessarily a permanent feature of one's face." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "Tune your television to any channel it doesn't receive and about 1 percent of the dancing static you see is accounted for by this ancient remnant of the Big Bang. The next time you complain that there is nothing on, remember that you can always watch the birth of the universe." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West
